Remarks: Ethics chairs were called for AFTER the reviewing process

Chairs: Xanda Schofield, Min-Yen Kan, Malvina Nissim
Remarks: 2 papers were recommended for rejection on ethical grounds - but both were rejected on technical grounds before the process wrapped up. While 195 papers received some kind of ethics review, 110 were found to fit in a set of common categories of issues;  to help reduce reviewer workload, EACs used boilerplate review text for these common situations. A situation arose where a paper was rejected by an AC in the regular review process for ethical reasons. PCs asked EACs to weigh in, and we elected to defer to the ACs in doing so (i.e., not to set precedent that the only way papers can be rejected for ethics concerns is via the ethics review process)
We wrote an "experience from EMNLP 2021 ethics review" document that we shared with the program chairs and others. We also shared this with Min Yen Kan and acl-ethics-chairs@inria.fr
15 conditional accepts, and an additonal 29 accepts with specific ethics comments (but no compliance checks)

Chairs: Kai-Wei Chang, Diyi Yang, Dirk Hovy
Nikhil Krishnaswamy, Constantine Lignos, Donia Scott

Remarks: 1) Some papers were directly reviewed and provided ethics meta reviewers by the Ethic Chairs (typically IRB issues) 2) Some papers were withdrawn during the process 3) 13 papers were found to have no ethical issues 4) 13 were withdrawn or deskreject  5) At the end no papers ended up being rejected for ethics reasons  6) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1L6t88N5n5ie_SzsC-2tyz4ooy3cqRKQmTfJA8Qua0OE/edit  is the draft Reviewer form with references to relevant documentation

Chairs: Luciana Benotti, Snigdha Chaturvedi, Sunipa Dev
Documentation source: We add here the ARR Ethics Guidelines * for authors: https://aclrollingreview.org/responsibleNLPresearch * for reviewers: https://aclrollingreview.org/ethicsreviewertutorial
URL: ARR prepared guidelines for flagging papers for ethics review: https://aclrollingreview.org/ethics-flagging-guidelines/. We add here the ARR Ethics Guidelines * for authors: https://aclrollingreview.org/responsibleNLPresearch * for reviewers: https://aclrollingreview.org/ethicsreviewertutorial
Remarks: The ethics reviewing process is coordinated by the ARR ethics chairs Vinodkumar Prabhakaran and Malihe Alikhani in collaboration with us, the EMNLP 2024 ethics chairs
